|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS32 |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 264 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = Parallel |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Spansion;S29AL032D90TFI03; |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = 3801088 |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 16 |ram1chip = SK hynix;HY5DU281622FTP-5; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = 32 |eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Broadcom;BCM5325F;BCM5325FKQMG RG0646 P11 802936 1A; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = IEEE 802.3/3u |portbasedvlan = [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=479138#479138 LAN ports only] |802.1qvlan = [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=479138#479138 LAN ports only] |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:1C:10,00:1D:7E |oui = 00:1C:10,00:1D:7E |bootwait = |stockbootloader = CFE;;; |stockos = |exp_if_types = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes |jtag = yes |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = CyberTAN |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT,OpenWrt |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 06/29/2007 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 5.9 x 6.7 x 1.5 in |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4321;BCM4321LKFBG UN0722 P21 824300 N3; |rad1chip2 = Broadcom;BCM2055;BCM2055KFB6 HE0719 P20 822522 N3; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = External Fixed |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = 12 |rad1cap = ap sta wet led wme 802.11d 802.11h rm cqa mbss4 afterburner }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== WRT150N v1.1 serial numbers ''appear'' to start with '''CQ61'''. ==Links of Interest== * [http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Linksys_WRT150N_%26_WRT160N On the DD-WRT wiki] * VLANs don't work [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=188606#188606 per Eko] [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VLcfl0ORuCY '''How to Disassemble/Open/Take Apart WRT150N WIFI Wireless Router''' on YouTube]
[http://www.pxdrive.com/picture/220238.html Pictures and part numbers] [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linksys_routers Listed on the 'Linksys routers' page on Wikipedia] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== {{DDWRTNotice|microno}} Supported by dd-wrt as of = v24 build 6384 20070329 #Read the [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=51486 Peacock Announcement] #Download THIS Newd_Mini file. ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/V24_TNG/svn12548/dd-wrt.v24-12548_NEWD_mini.bin. #Ensure you have a physical ethernet connection to your router, and disable your wireless adapter, antivirus/firewall protection, and any software that makes strong use of your network (BitTorrent, Streaming Audio/Video, etc). #Perform a [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/Hard_reset_or_30/30/30|hard 30/30/30]] reset. #Navigate to http://192.168.1.1/ in your web browser of choice. #Enter no username, and the password "admin". #Go to the administration tab. Click on firmware upgrade. #Browse to the .bin file you downloaded in step 2 #Click on the upgrade button and WAIT for the upgrade successful message. #Power cycle your router. Wait until you can see the DD-WRT password screen at [http://192.168.1.1/]. #Perform another [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/Hard_reset_or_30/30/30|30/30/30]] reset on your router. Wait until you can see the password screen at [http://192.168.1.1/]. #Set a new username and password, and continue on to configure your router like normal. You can now upgrade to any generic DD-WRT build except Mega and Micro. Be sure to always do a hard reset prior to flashing another build, do a power cycle followed by another hard reset after flashing, and NEVER re-use a configuration file from a previous build or another router. Always reconfigure from scratch. ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = |wikipage = |forumpage = |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = |subtarget = |arch = |support_started_version = ? |current_supported_version = ? |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = }} Please insert instructions here ==Upgrading== {{Upgrade dd-wrt}} ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== ====JTAG Pinouts==== nTRST 1o o2 GND TDI 3o o4 GND TDO 5o o6 GND TMS 7o o8 GND TCK 9o o10 GND nSRST 11o o12 N/C '''Using [[TechInfoDepot:JTAG/TIAO/Universal_JTAG_Adapter|Universal JTAG Adapter]]''' white 1o o2 black red 3o o4 GND blue 5o o6 GND green 7o o8 GND yelow 9o o10 GND orange 11o o12 N/C =====JTAG Recovery===== #Backup CFE x2 (Compare the files, they must match exactly or there is something wrong with your JTAG setup) #Erase Wholeflash x2 #Flash CFE #Unplug Power #Unplug JTAG Cable [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/TFTP_flash#Linksys_TFTP_GUI|TFTP]]: #Set Rig ip static 192.168.1.10 #Plug network cable from rig to port 1 #Plug in power #click upgrade. #wait, wait, wait. If you cannot browse the GUI of the router, return to step 1. #Hard Reset 30\30\30 ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== VCC 1 o TX 2 o RX 3 o N/C 4 o GND 5 o ==vlan Info== * [[TechInfoDepot:DD-WRT/VLAN_Support|VLAN Support]] 1 2 3 4 | case labels 0 1 2 3 | nvram port numbers ==Pictures==

[[Has images::fcc| ]] ==Notes== =====Security LED===== * [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=67102 (solved) Security LED Script WRT300n v1.1] * The security LED will not light up after flashing on version 1.1. To fix this, go to '''Administration > Commands''', type in the following and then click '''Save Startup''': while sleep 1; do if [ `nvram get wl0_security_mode` = "disabled" ]; then gpio enable 3; else gpio disable 3; fi; done & As [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=489471#489471 posted] by osmosis On the wiki for 150N is posted root@DD-WRT:~# gpio enable 5 #(SECURITY LED - off - green) root@DD-WRT:~# gpio disable 5 #(SECURITY LED - on - green) root@DD-WRT:~# gpio disable 3 #(SECURITY LED - on - amber) root@DD-WRT:~# gpio enable 3 #(SECURITY LED - off - amber) this applies for the [[Linksys WRT300N v1.0|WRT300Nv1.0]] as well so to incorporate the amber into the mix as not secure: Also confirmed working on the WRT300N v1.1 [[User:WifiShadow|WifiShadow]] 02:40, October 1, 2010 (UTC) while sleep 1; do if [ `nvram get wl0_security_mode` = "disabled" ]; then gpio enable 5 gpio disable 3 else gpio enable 3 gpio disable 5 fi done & [[Category:English Documentation]]
